texts.orig: CYBERSECURITY (AMENDMENT) BILL, 2025
texts.text: CYBERSECURITY (AMENDMENT) BILL, 2025

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: AN ACT to amend the Cybersecurity Act, 2020 (Act 1038) to confer powers on the Cyber Security Authority to investigate and prosecute cybercrime on the authority of the Attorney-General  and  recover  proceeds  of  cybercrime;  to  revise  the  object  and functions of the Cyber Security Authority; to revise the governance and administration of the Cyber Security Authority;  to revise the enforcement powers of the Cyber Security Authority and to provide for related matters.
texts.text: AN ACT to amend the Cybersecurity Act, 2020 (Act 1038) to confer powers on the Cyber Security Authority to investigate and prosecute cybercrime on the authority of the Attorney-General  and  recover  proceeds  of  cybercrime;  to  revise  the  object  and functions of the Cyber Security Authority; to revise the governance and administration of the Cyber Security Authority;  to revise the enforcement powers of the Cyber Security Authority and to provide for related matters.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Section 3 of Act 1038 Amended
texts.text: Section 3 of Act 1038 Amended

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The Cybersecurity Act, 2020 (Act 1038) referred to in the Act as the 'principal enactment' is amended by substitution for section 3, of
texts.text: The Cybersecurity Act, 2020 (Act 1038) referred to in the Act as the 'principal enactment' is amended by substitution for section 3, of

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: ' Objects of the Authority
texts.text: ' Objects of the Authority

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The objects of the Authority are to:
texts.text: The objects of the Authority are to:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) regulate cybersecurity activities in the country;
texts.text: (a) regulate cybersecurity activities in the country;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) prevent, manage and respond to cybersecurity threats and cybersecurity incidents;
texts.text: (b) prevent, manage and respond to cybersecurity threats and cybersecurity incidents;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) regulate  owners  of  critical  information  infrastructure  in  respect  of cybersecurity activities, cybersecurity service providers, cybersecurity professionals and practitioners, and cybersecurity establishments in the country;
texts.text: (c) regulate  owners  of  critical  information  infrastructure  in  respect  of cybersecurity activities, cybersecurity service providers, cybersecurity professionals and practitioners, and cybersecurity establishments in the country;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (d) promote the development of cybersecurity in the country to ensure a secured and resilient digital ecosystem;
texts.text: (d) promote the development of cybersecurity in the country to ensure a secured and resilient digital ecosystem;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (e) prevent and detect cybercrime;
texts.text: (e) prevent and detect cybercrime;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (f) to facilitate the confiscation of proceeds of cybercrime;
texts.text: (f) to facilitate the confiscation of proceeds of cybercrime;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (g) establish  a  platform  for  cross-sector  engagement  on  matters  of cybersecurity for effective co-ordination and co-operation between key public institutions and the private sector;
texts.text: (g) establish  a  platform  for  cross-sector  engagement  on  matters  of cybersecurity for effective co-ordination and co-operation between key public institutions and the private sector;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (h) create awareness of cybersecurity matters; and
texts.text: (h) create awareness of cybersecurity matters; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (i) collaborate  with  States,  inter-governmental  bodies,  international organisations and international agencies to promote the cybersecurity of the country.'.
texts.text: (i) collaborate  with  States,  inter-governmental  bodies,  international organisations and international agencies to promote the cybersecurity of the country.'.

texts.text: Section 4A inserted

texts.text: The principal enactment is amended by the insertion after section 4, of

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: ' Further Functions of the Authority
texts.text: ' Further Functions of the Authority

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: CYBERSECURITY (AMENDMENT) BILL, 2025
texts.text: CYBERSECURITY (AMENDMENT) BILL, 2025

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4A. The Authority, shall in addition to the functions in section 4, carry out the following functions:
texts.text: 4A. The Authority, shall in addition to the functions in section 4, carry out the following functions:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) subject  to  article  88  of  the  Constitution,  to  investigate  and  on  the authority of the Attorney-General, prosecute cybercrime under this Act;
texts.text: (a) subject  to  article  88  of  the  Constitution,  to  investigate  and  on  the authority of the Attorney-General, prosecute cybercrime under this Act;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) establish standards for certifying the security of innovative products, Artificial  Intelligence,  cloud  technology,  quantum  computing,  big data, Internet of Things (IoT) , blockchain-based technology and any other emerging technologies;
texts.text: (b) establish standards for certifying the security of innovative products, Artificial  Intelligence,  cloud  technology,  quantum  computing,  big data, Internet of Things (IoT) , blockchain-based technology and any other emerging technologies;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) certify  the  security  of  innovative  products    Artificial  Intelligence, cloud technology, quantum computing, big data, Internet of Things (IoT), blockchain-based technology and any other emerging technologies, in accordance with the standards established pursuant to paragraph (b);
texts.text: (c) certify  the  security  of  innovative  products    Artificial  Intelligence, cloud technology, quantum computing, big data, Internet of Things (IoT), blockchain-based technology and any other emerging technologies, in accordance with the standards established pursuant to paragraph (b);

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (d) accredit  the  cybersecurity  establishments  of critical  information infrastructure owners, cybersecurity service providers, cybersecurity practitioners and professionals and other relevant persons or institutions;
texts.text: (d) accredit  the  cybersecurity  establishments  of critical  information infrastructure owners, cybersecurity service providers, cybersecurity practitioners and professionals and other relevant persons or institutions;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (e) accredit non-profit cybersecurity institutions and cybersecurity professional bodies;
texts.text: (e) accredit non-profit cybersecurity institutions and cybersecurity professional bodies;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (f) promote  the  online  protection  of  women,  elderly,  persons  with disabilities and underserved populations;
texts.text: (f) promote  the  online  protection  of  women,  elderly,  persons  with disabilities and underserved populations;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (g) collaborate with relevant institutions to develop mechanisms including technical security solutions and guidelines on the usage of smart technology and other emerging technologies; and
texts.text: (g) collaborate with relevant institutions to develop mechanisms including technical security solutions and guidelines on the usage of smart technology and other emerging technologies; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (h) promote the protection of digital rights as it relates to cybersecurity.'.
texts.text: (h) promote the protection of digital rights as it relates to cybersecurity.'.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. The principal enactment is amended  in section 14 by the substitution for subsection (1), of
texts.text: The principal enactment is amended  in section 14 by the substitution for subsection (1), of

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: '14     (1). The Joint Cybersecurity Committee shall collaborate with the Authority and the  sectors  or  institutions  represented  on  the  Committee  for  the  implementation  of relevant cybersecurity measures including but not limited to the following ways:
texts.text: '14     (1). The Joint Cybersecurity Committee shall collaborate with the Authority and the  sectors  or  institutions  represented  on  the  Committee  for  the  implementation  of relevant cybersecurity measures including but not limited to the following ways:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) identification  of  cybersecurity  risks  that  may  affect  critical  information infrastructure or the overall cybersecurity of the country;
texts.text: (a) identification  of  cybersecurity  risks  that  may  affect  critical  information infrastructure or the overall cybersecurity of the country;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) development  of  cybersecurity  policies  and  guidelines  based  on  identified risks,  best  practices  and  international  standards  to  mitigate  cybersecurity risks;
texts.text: (b) development  of  cybersecurity  policies  and  guidelines  based  on  identified risks,  best  practices  and  international  standards  to  mitigate  cybersecurity risks;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) coordination  of  cybersecurity  activities  between  sectors  and  entities  to ensure that all cybersecurity efforts are aligned to prevent overlap and gaps;
texts.text: (c) coordination  of  cybersecurity  activities  between  sectors  and  entities  to ensure that all cybersecurity efforts are aligned to prevent overlap and gaps;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (d) facilitate the sharing of information between sectors and entities in a secure manner and in compliance with relevant data protection laws;
texts.text: (d) facilitate the sharing of information between sectors and entities in a secure manner and in compliance with relevant data protection laws;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (e) collaboration with sectors or institutions to tackle cybercrime including the provision  of  a  platform  for  incidence  sharing  and  incidence  response mechanisms to facilitate;
texts.text: (e) collaboration with sectors or institutions to tackle cybercrime including the provision  of  a  platform  for  incidence  sharing  and  incidence  response mechanisms to facilitate;

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: CYBERSECURITY (AMENDMENT) BILL, 2025
texts.text: CYBERSECURITY (AMENDMENT) BILL, 2025

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (f) evaluation of the effectiveness of implemented cybersecurity measures based on established metrics with a view to continuously improve the cybersecurity measures; and
texts.text: (f) evaluation of the effectiveness of implemented cybersecurity measures based on established metrics with a view to continuously improve the cybersecurity measures; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (g) collaboration with the Authority to educate the public on matters related to cybercrime and cybersecurity.'.
texts.text: (g) collaboration with the Authority to educate the public on matters related to cybercrime and cybersecurity.'.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 15A. (1) The President shall in accordance with article 195 of the Constitution appoint  such  Deputy  Directors-General  as  are  necessary  for  the  performance  of  the functions of the Authority.
texts.text: 15A. (1) The President shall in accordance with article 195 of the Constitution appoint  such  Deputy  Directors-General  as  are  necessary  for  the  performance  of  the functions of the Authority.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2) The Deputy Directors-General shall hold office  on  the terms  and conditions specified in the letters of appointment.
texts.text: The Deputy Directors-General shall hold office  on  the terms  and conditions specified in the letters of appointment.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3) The  Deputy  Directors-General  shall  act  in  the  absence  of  the Director-General and perform any other functions as determined by the  Board.
texts.text: The  Deputy  Directors-General  shall  act  in  the  absence  of  the Director-General and perform any other functions as determined by the  Board.

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: The Deputy Directors-General shall, subject to the provisions of this Act:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) assist  the  Director-General  in  the  discharge  of  his  functions  and perform such other functions as the Director-General or the Board may delegate to him;
texts.text: (a) assist  the  Director-General  in  the  discharge  of  his  functions  and perform such other functions as the Director-General or the Board may delegate to him;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) perform  functions  related  to  the  object  and  functions  of  the Authority on the direction or authority of the Director-General or the Board; and
texts.text: (b) perform  functions  related  to  the  object  and  functions  of  the Authority on the direction or authority of the Director-General or the Board; and

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: (c) be responsible for the direction of the Authority when the DirectorGeneral is absent from Ghana or is otherwise unable to perform his functions.'.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 20B. texts.text: A  provider  of  wire  or  electronic  communication  services  or  a  remote computing  service  on  the  written  request  of  a  law  enforcement  agency,  shall  take  the necessary steps to preserve records and other evidence in its possession pending the issue of a Court order and shall take steps to ensure that the request by the law enforcement agency is not disclosed to third parties during the period.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2) Where an order from the Court is not obtained and served for fourteen days after the receipt of the written request, the wire or electronic communication services, or remote computing service provider is not under any obligation to preserve the evidence.
texts.text: Where an order from the Court is not obtained and served for fourteen days after the receipt of the written request, the wire or electronic communication services, or remote computing service provider is not under any obligation to preserve the evidence.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3) An investigative officer authorised by a designated officer may apply ex-parte to  the  Court  for  an  order  to  require  a  service  provider  or  any  person  in  control  of  a computer or computer system to preserve specified computer data, including traffic data that has been stored by a computer system.

texts.text: 'Witness and Informant Protection

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 59K. (1) Except with the  written,  informed,  explicit  and  freely  given  consent of  a witness  or  informant,  no  witness  or  informant  who  discloses  information  relating  to cybercrime under this Act or administrative infractions under this Act, shall be obliged to disclose  his   name  or  address  or  other personal  information, or state any matter which might lead to their discovery.
texts.text: 59K. (1) Except with the  written,  informed,  explicit  and  freely  given  consent of  a witness  or  informant,  no  witness  or  informant  who  discloses  information  relating  to cybercrime under this Act or administrative infractions under this Act, shall be obliged to disclose  his   name  or  address  or  other personal  information, or state any matter which might lead to their discovery.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (2) Unless otherwise provided, the information and the identity of the witness or informant shall be held to be secret between the Authority and the witness or informer; and all matters relating to such information should be privileged and shall not be disclosed in any proceedings before any court, tribunal, commission, or authority.
texts.text: (2) Unless otherwise provided, the information and the identity of the witness or informant shall be held to be secret between the Authority and the witness or informer; and all matters relating to such information should be privileged and shall not be disclosed in any proceedings before any court, tribunal, commission, or authority.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3) The Authority take all necessary and reasonable steps to protect the safety and welfare of a witness or informant, and such the protection shall extend to persons by virtue of being related to a witness or informant, or on account of a testimony given by a witness  or  informer,  or  for  any  other  reason  upon  which  the  Authority  may  consider sufficient.'.
texts.text: The Authority take all necessary and reasonable steps to protect the safety and welfare of a witness or informant, and such the protection shall extend to persons by virtue of being related to a witness or informant, or on account of a testimony given by a witness  or  informer,  or  for  any  other  reason  upon  which  the  Authority  may  consider sufficient.'.

texts.orig: '(1) A  person  who,  without  lawful  authority  accesses  or  retrieves  subscriber information or intercepts traffic data or content data, commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine of not less than two thousand five hundred penalty units and not more than fifteen thousand penalty units or to a term of imprisonment of not less than two years and not more than five years or, to both.
texts.text: '(1) A  person  who,  without  lawful  authority  accesses  or  retrieves  subscriber information or intercepts traffic data or content data, commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine of not less than two thousand five hundred penalty units and not more than fifteen thousand penalty units or to a term of imprisonment of not less than two years and not more than five years or, to both.

texts.orig: '(4) Despite  subsection  (1),  for  the  purposes  of  extradition,  Cybercrime  and Cyber  Offences  under  the  First  Schedule  to  this  Act,  in  the  absence  of  a  separate arrangement, bilateral or multilateral agreement between Ghana and another signatory of the Budapest Convention on Cybercrime or any other convention, extradition of fugitive criminals  may  still  take  place  between  Ghana  and  another  signatory  of  the  Budapest Convention  on  Cybercrime  or  any  other  convention  and  shall  be  governed  by  the provisions of the said convention.'.
